Posts.Content: Sep 13, 2011 11:22AM tjohnson1971 wrote: Thanks for that.  Did you ever have any nipple pain or symptoms?  Did you have a family history? I will ask for an MRI when I meet with surgeon on THursday.  I keep thinking that when they remove that lump, it will have bad cells in it.
Posts.Title: Anyone w/ ALH on biopsy get different results after surgery? tjohnson1971 funsizejen

Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2011 01:41PM tjohnson1971 wrote: Wow LisaAlissa, that really helped me.  My excisional biopsy (or lumpectomy, was told they are pretty much the same thing by my surgeon) is also the 29th.  I did have a stereotactic biopsy 2 mos. ago first that showed atypical lobular hyperplasiaand have hated waiting this long to get this over with.  I do know how you feel Claire.  Good luck.  I really liked what you said, "all i have to do is show up-what I think now has nothing to do with the results."  I need to focus on that.  However, I did request some xanax if needed too.  Thanks.

Also, how are you healing and feeling?  Mine is tomorrow so it would be great to know what to expect.  Thanks, tj Hoping for good results.

Posts.Title: Did any of you get crabby or depressed before lumpectomy? tjohnson1971 Natters

Posts.Content: Sep 28, 2011 10:14AM tjohnson1971 wrote: Yes, thank you Anne, I am hoping it's nothing more too.  Wow that's good you can hardly see the sar now, that's reassuring.  I was thinking I was gonna have a frankestein scar on my boob, but if it fades good. What does conscious sedation mean?  Mean, you could wake up, or  you are in a deep sleep?  I had one surgery for something else, and it was sedation, a passed out before they even wheeled my into the operating room, and woke up from this marvelous sleep after it was done.  That's what I am hoping for.  Was this similar?
Posts.Title: Did any of you get crabby or depressed before lumpectomy? tjohnson1971 Natters

Posts.Content: Sep 30, 2011 02:26PM tjohnson1971 wrote: Thanks, I am calling now!
Posts.Title: Did any of you get crabby or depressed before lumpectomy? tjohnson1971 Natters

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2011 01:15PM tjohnson1971 wrote: I am going to urgent care today, still was feeling bably, but not the incision site.  Migrain getting worse, plue lots of itchiness of my skin, nausea, dry mouth, lack of appetite.  I am thinking I may be allergic to the hydrocodone/vicadin.  My last one was at 6:30am, waited until 9:30 to take IMITREX for migrains.  My boob is sort of throbing a little but I think I can tolerate it.  They told me not to eat or drink anything until I get there.  Really?  I think that's why I feel so crappy, I have not eaten in a few days.  And guess what, I gained 4 lbs the day of surgery!  How does that happen?  I had not eaten for 20hrs!  I will just be glad when headache is over and I can think more clearly.
Posts.Title: Did any of you get crabby or depressed before lumpectomy? tjohnson1971 Natters

Posts.Content: Oct 2, 2011 09:49AM tjohnson1971 wrote: Natters,  Yes my 7 year old son keeps forgetting and either bumps me and hugs me too hard.  But other than that, I can't believe how much better I feel with no medication.  I hated the way I was feeling, and kept thinking this is what I supposed to feel like after surgery.  Yuck.  I am glad my body didn't like those things, amazing how quickly and how much better I feel now. Question:  Did any of you ever feel like there were so many coincedences around you?  Since this has come about, I feel like when you get a new car, you see that new car, same color, style, etc. driving all around town, when you never noticed it before.  Well, I have been getting so many things in the mail, newspaper, tv, emails, ads, seeing things in stores for sale, all around me.  I wonder if this is supposed to mean something or just a coincedence.  Like am I supposed to be preparing myself for the news or this is just breast cancer awareness month?  I know it's October, but it just seems weird regardless.
Posts.Title: Did any of you get crabby or depressed before lumpectomy? tjohnson1971 Natters

Posts.Content: Oct 4, 2011 01:53PM tjohnson1971 wrote: Just got call from BS and it LCIS, so good it's not cancer.  I already had ALH.  They are referring me to oncologist to ask questions.  I am wondering if there is anything I can do as a preventative, like tamox?
Posts.Title: Did any of you get crabby or depressed before lumpectomy? tjohnson1971 Natters

Posts.Content: Sep 29, 2011 08:57PM tjohnson1971 wrote: Just wanted to let you know, everything went fine.  It was a long 9 hours there, my surgery got delayed.  But wire insertion went smooth, I never needed anxiety meds, I felt pretty positive this morning.  A little sleepy now that we are  home and nauseous after trying to eat some dinner, I have not eaten in 20 hours!  Glad to be home, thanks for the well wishes.  It wasn't bad.  No stitches on the outside, they glued it shut.  Now we wait 5 days to find out what the rest of that lump was!  Sweet dreams, tj
Posts.Title: Did any of you get crabby or depressed before lumpectomy? tjohnson1971 Natters

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2011 07:57PM tjohnson1971 wrote: I am feeling 100% better.   This morning at 6:30am was the last dose of vicadin I took.  Took a migrain medication at 9:30 and by 2-3pm was feeling like myself again.  Clear minded, not nauseous or itchy and hot.  Dry mouth went away.   At the doctors we figured I was allergic to the vicadin.  Makes sense to me, I stopped it and feel like myself again!  Yeah.  They gave me anti nausea and anti itch prescriptions but I don't even feel I need them.  Just took some advil for minor soreness on my boob and feel great!  Thanks for your help ladies.
Posts.Title: Did any of you get crabby or depressed before lumpectomy? tjohnson1971 Natters

Posts.Content: Oct 3, 2011 09:20AM tjohnson1971 wrote: Now, I wish I had said no thanks, I will wait and see what happens.  The drugs did make me feel much worse than I was supposed to feel.  Glad that is over with and if there is ever a next time, I will know to leave that alone, it was horrible.  I hope all these little signs don't actually mean anything, however, if it does mean something, then so be it.  It is what it is, and I have no control over what was in there. Gigil, what were your signs about your cancer?  Was it found by you or a mammogram?  Just curious.  I am 40, how old are you?  Sorry if this is too personal, you don't have to answer.   Thanks, tj
Posts.Title: Did any of you get crabby or depressed before lumpectomy? tjohnson1971 Natters

Posts.Content: Sep 24, 2011 07:30PM tjohnson1971 wrote: Thank  you so much for this support.  It has helped me a lot not to feel alone.  Nobody ever wants to be alone...most of the time.  I appreciate your time.
Posts.Title: Did any of you get crabby or depressed before lumpectomy? tjohnson1971 Natters

Posts.Content: Sep 27, 2011 04:14PM tjohnson1971 wrote: I agree GIGIL, all the mammogram, ultrasounds and radiology techs have been very kind and warm and sensative to this very personal thing we go through.  This week I am less anxious and crabby.  I think I am really  feeling so much better and relieved with all the support here.  Family and friends don't get it unless they have done it.  They mean well though. In a previous surgery a few years ago, I remember waking up from this awesome sleep, and not wanting them to wake me up...I don't get that well rested nornally with kids!  So in a weird way, am looking forward to that. So with your first biopsy, were you diagnosed with stage 1 cancer?   I am hoping that the Atypical Lobular Hyperplasia doesn't came back with something more and just more of the same thing.  Will be happy to get my call 5 days later, so I can stop wondering  and just know what it is i have for sure. Thanks for your help.
Posts.Title: Did any of you get crabby or depressed before lumpectomy? tjohnson1971 Natters

Posts.Content: Sep 28, 2011 11:06AM tjohnson1971 wrote: ok thanks awb, that clears it up for me.  Yep, I plan to do nothing the following day.  I already got my new book by the bed ready to go.  Luckily my surgery check in is not until 11am tomorrow.  So we can still drop off the kids at school like normal and then I can come home and put a stew in the crockpot.  They said I should be going home between 4:30-5pm, so at least my husband won't have to worry about what to make for dinner.  And if we are lucky there will be leftovers!
Posts.Title: Did any of you get crabby or depressed before lumpectomy? tjohnson1971 Natters

Posts.Content: Sep 28, 2011 11:35AM tjohnson1971 wrote: Natters.  Wow, you made me teary.  That all sounds really good.  Yes, my stereotactic biopsy was not pleasant, I cried the whole time, not because it hurt because it was just scarey and emotional.  My mother in law was diagnosed at 40 and that's all I could think of since that's how old I am now. She passed away 17 years later.  Anyway. I agree about DH feeling weird during this time too.  I can sense it, he is worried.   I was just asking myself what my gut says it is, not that this is realiable, but I just think it will come back more abnormal cells (ALH) but not anything else.  I will just have to monitor my boobies regularly and luckily will be more prepared if this ever happens again. I like your ideas about bringing food to friends, I will remember that.  I don't work, I have been a stay at home mom for 10 years now.  Funny, I used to work in the cytology lab where we would diagnose breast cancer and other things too.  Even used to go on fine needle aspirations and core biopsies, but because I was young and naive, didn't even think about what those poor women were going through.  Just did my job.  Sad.   This site is incredible with support and I feel so much better than before about all this.  Eithe way, what ever happens, there is someone here rooting for you!  Thanks.
Posts.Title: Did any of you get crabby or depressed before lumpectomy? tjohnson1971 Natters

Posts.Content: Sep 29, 2011 07:14AM tjohnson1971 wrote: Excited to get this over with and done today.  Does that make sense?  Thank you for the pink cloud, I will look for it! =)
Posts.Title: Did any of you get crabby or depressed before lumpectomy? tjohnson1971 Natters

Posts.Content: Oct 3, 2011 10:18AM tjohnson1971 wrote: Natters, Yep, went in for my 1st routine mammo in July because I am 40 now and they could see lump right away.  This lead to another more squished mammon and ultrasound, then stereotactic biopsy and now the lumpectomy.  The biopsy said Atypical Lobular Hyperplasis (precursor for cancer) that's why they removed it, and hopefully they rest of that lump is more of the same stuff.  (I may have mentioned during this whole process it's been interesting watching peoples body languages when they see stuff or wish you good luck when you leave---I wasn't aware before I got here that I would need luck?)   I gave myself routine checks, and everything in there feels so lumpy bumpy anyway, I never knew the difference.  Even after I figured out where the lump was after the ultrasound, I went home and tried to feel for it, but couldn't.  It was supposed to 1.6cm, you'd think I could feel a marble?   How do you feel on Tamox?
Posts.Title: Did any of you get crabby or depressed before lumpectomy? tjohnson1971 Natters

Posts.Content: Oct 5, 2011 11:54AM tjohnson1971 wrote: I am still confused about this diagnosis of LCIS.  I read yesterday that the lobules are filled with cancer cells, they have just not spread out beyond that barrier to become invasive.  I also read that, compared to ductal carcinoma, when it does become invasive it's more aggressive than ductal.  To me, knowing there were cancer cells there is not seem good.  Plus I read, most LCIS is not caught on mammo, although mine was?  And most wowan are  40-50 which I am 40.  Hmmm, not sure what to make of this.  They gave me a referral to oncologist, so hoping to ask more questions there and get some information.  Also have an old coworker who I used to work in Pathology with 10 years ago, check into getting me a second opinion and having my slides looked at by the doctor I know there.  That would be conforting, knowing the person who looks at your slides, trusting them.
Posts.Title: Did any of you get crabby or depressed before lumpectomy? tjohnson1971 Natters

Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2011 08:12PM tjohnson1971 wrote: Yeah, the wire insertion is one aspect that causes me anxiety.  I got a call today that they are prescribing me 4 xanax pills, one to be taken 30minutes before procedure, so hopefully that helps calm me down.  I wish I didn't have to see them inserting a wire, and hope they get it right the first time too.  I am also bummed there will be an empty spot on my already smaller boob, I wear tight tshirts sometimes, so that may look funny?   My mother in law got breast cancer at 40years old and died at 57.  I know she would have been so helpful during this time for me.   I also think that is where a lot of my fear is coming from too.  My husband and I were so young (16) when she was going through her treatments, we were sort of left out of it, I guess to protect her only son.  Now I wish I would have asked more questions, not just about this but so many other things too. Thank you Leaf for your time and help with this, it's good not to feel alone.
Posts.Title: Did any of you get crabby or depressed before lumpectomy? tjohnson1971 Natters

Posts.Content: Sep 25, 2011 03:25PM tjohnson1971 wrote: I am not sure if I am just less nervous or what, but feel more at ease the last few days.  It may be because I was able to ask questions here and feel like a normal person who is scared, and it's ok.  I agree with you about, people are trying not to deal with their own uncomfortable feelings.  I guess if things were turned around, I really wouldn't know what to say or how to act either.  I guess you don't want to cry or overexagerate or even worry a person who is going through some thing like this.  I think I would do the wait and see approach too.  Or as my husband says, it is what it is, and we will just deal with it.  I do feel better, less anxious knowing I have that Xanax if I need it on Thursday, versus nothing at all.  I had stitches on my finger recently so I know if will take me some days to feel normal again and I will heal up. Thanks again for the support.  It helps.
Posts.Title: Did any of you get crabby or depressed before lumpectomy? tjohnson1971 Natters

Posts.Content: Sep 28, 2011 07:27AM tjohnson1971 wrote: My excisional biopsy/pumpectomy is tomorrow at 11am.  I was told by surgeon that excisioan biopsy and lumpectomy are the same thing, but sometimes I wonder if the term lumpectormy means something more serious, although, they are removing a lump and extra tissue around it, so I think they use the terms interchangeably.  Anyway ready to get this done.
Posts.Title: Did any of you get crabby or depressed before lumpectomy? tjohnson1971 Natters

Posts.Content: Sep 28, 2011 05:10PM - edited Sep 28, 2011 05:10PM by tjohnson1971 This has been so awesome, I am filled up with all this kindness.  I don't feel as alone as I would had I not found this site.  I can't say thank you enough to all you brave, loving and compassionate women out there.  I wish I could hug you all.   Thanks for the advice alaska, I plan to bring a pillow in the car just in case.  In fact, I should do that now! Can't wait to let know how it goes.   I like your statement, "hidden badge of courage"  I may use that with my hubby later on.  I definitely don't want to forget what this feels like, because perhaps, whether or not this is something, I can help someone down the line too. Love you guys, Tiffany
Posts.Title: Did any of you get crabby or depressed before lumpectomy? tjohnson1971 Natters

Posts.Content: Sep 30, 2011 11:15AM tjohnson1971 wrote: Did any of you have anyside effects from anesthesia?  I have a terrible headach, nausea and vomiting.  Also not peecing much like normal and I am really thirsty, so Iam drinking. I vomited all liquid.  If so let me know please, thanks.
Posts.Title: Did any of you get crabby or depressed before lumpectomy? tjohnson1971 Natters

Posts.Content: Sep 20, 2011 09:47PM tjohnson1971 wrote: Yeah, I drove myself home and took a nap, only because I cried during the whole thing.  Not that it hurt, only that it was emotionally scarey.  My mother in law died of breast cancer at 57, and got it when she was 40, same age as I am now.  I was nervous before going in and then met a breast cancer survivor in the waiting room, who shared her cancer story.  I was sobbing before I even went in the room!  Anyway, still trudged on to soccer practice and made dinner for family of four.  Just bring ice pack with you wherever you go in a little ice chest.  I iced in the car on the way to certain events for a two days and then of course while at home.  Not bad bruising here but still have a scar tissue lump leftover and was told last week to massage it so it will soften.  Hope this helps.
Posts.Title: Stereotactic Biopsy-Nervous dlm217 bonbondidit4

Posts.Content: Sep 20, 2011 04:55PM tjohnson1971 wrote: I am having a wire biopsy on the 29th, so I will be thinking of you the next day too.  They told me to buy a tight fitting jogging bra.  So I hope that's all I need.  It's hard not to worry, I am in your same shoes.  I hate that by the time I have this biopsy, it will be 8 wks since the stereotactic biopsy!  That's too log for me to be over thinking all this.
